page.title: 01Glaisdale Moor
page.content: The southern part is higher heather moorland used for sheep grazing and grouse shootig but a large area is taken up by Upper Glaisdale valley and in the north west by Great Fryup Dale. These steep sided valleys being more sheltered are farmed, mainly sheep and cattle grazing. There are some fairly large commerical conifer plantation on the slopes, and a scattering of dieciduous woodland in the valleys. There are no villages and the residents all live in a scattering of farms in the valleys and most will be involved in farming. There are some minor public road so access is easy and the area is quite popular, being closest to Eskdale, with tourists. The area is also much visited by walkers who come to enjoy the spectacular National park scenery
